Over 12,000 dogs in the San Francisco area are left homeless each year.

You can do something about it.

Our Message

Every day, we pick up dozens of homeless dogs and runaways. Even with the current volunteering efforts of the community, we are still in danger of having to euthanize these poor animals. We were made to inform owners of the responsibilities of adoption; that is, being absolutely sure to go into detail of the joys as well as the downsides of becoming a dog owner. In addition to our passionate volunteers, the love of dogs is what keeps our company running. You can help.

Our Story

San Francisco Dog Rescue was originally founded by a couple that had just moved to the Bay area from Kentucky, Fred and Wilma Sampson. The Sampsons owned a multitude of dogs themselves, each of which had their own special rescue story.

Despite the Sampsonâ€™s gracious efforts, they found they had no more space to care for any more dogs. That is when, in 1999, they opened their first halfway home for dogs, where they would search for loving homes for the abandoned animals.

Today, San Francisco Dog Rescue has re-homed over two-thousand dogs. Rescue a dog, adopt today!
